senses.sense_definition: Resembling an inquisition, especially by being harsh, severe, or offensively prying during questioning.

examples.text: The manager adopted an <w>inquisitorial</w> tone when asking the staff about the missing documents.
She felt uncomfortable under his <w>inquisitorial</w> gaze throughout the entire dinner.

senses.sense_definition: Relating to a legal system where the court or judge actively investigates the facts of the case, rather than acting as a neutral referee.

examples.text: Many European countries utilize an <w>inquisitorial</w> system for criminal trials.
In an <w>inquisitorial</w> procedure, the judge plays a central role in gathering evidence.

senses.sense_definition: Relating to the historical Inquisition, a period of intense religious suppression and interrogation by the Catholic Church.

examples.text: The museum displayed various instruments used during the <w>inquisitorial</w> trials of the Middle Ages.
Historians have analyzed the <w>inquisitorial</w> records to understand the scope of the persecution.
